courses.name: Introduction to Computer Science
courses.description: An introductory course covering fundamental concepts in computer science including algorithms, data structures, and programming principles.
courses.notes: This course provides the foundation for all subsequent computer science courses.

courses.name: Discrete Mathematics
courses.description: Introduction to discrete mathematical structures and their applications in computer science.

courses.name: Data Structures and Algorithms
courses.description: Comprehensive study of data structures and algorithms with emphasis on implementation and analysis.

courses.name: Database Systems
courses.description: Introduction to database design, SQL, and database management systems.

courses.name: Software Engineering
courses.description: Principles and practices of software engineering including design patterns, testing, and project management.

courses.name: Machine Learning
courses.description: Introduction to machine learning algorithms, techniques, and applications.

courses.name: Linear Algebra
courses.description: Study of vector spaces, linear transformations, and their applications.

courses.name: Computer Networks
courses.description: Fundamentals of computer networking including protocols, architecture, and security.

courses.name: Web Development
courses.description: Modern web development technologies and frameworks for building interactive applications.

courses.name: Capstone Project
courses.description: Culminating project demonstrating mastery of computer science concepts through a significant software development project.
courses.notes: Requires approval from faculty advisor. Must be completed in the final semester.

notes: Prerequisites must be completed before taking advanced courses
